trans-unit.source: The RecipientInfo class represents information about a CMS/PKCS #7 message recipient.

The RecipientInfo class is an abstract class inherited by the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo"></xref> classes.
This is an abstract class that cannot be instantiated.
It is inherited by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo> classes.
The EncryptedKey abstract property retrieves the encrypted recipient keying material.
This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.
An array of byte values that contain the encrypted recipient keying material.
The KeyEncryptionAlgorithm abstract property retrieves the algorithm used to perform the key establishment.
This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.

An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> object that contains the value of the algorithm used to establish the key between the originator and recipient of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.
The RecipientIdentifier abstract property retrieves the identifier of the recipient.
This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier"></xref> object that contains the identifier of the recipient.
The Type property retrieves the type of the recipient.
The type of the recipient determines which of two major protocols is used to establish a key between the originator and the recipient of a CMS/PKCS #7 message.
A value of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfoType"></xref> enumeration that defines the type of the recipient.
The Version abstract property retrieves the version of the recipient information.
Derived classes automatically set this property for their objects, and the value indicates whether it is using PKCS #7 or Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) to protect messages.

The version also implies whether the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo"></xref> object establishes a cryptographic key by a key agreement algorithm or a key transport algorithm.
This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.
The version determines whether the message is a PKCS #7 message or a CMS message.
CMS is a newer superset of PKCS #7.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the version of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo"></xref> object.
